questions.text: It is believed that Gypsies originated in what place?
The name 'Gypsy' is a corruption of the word for what nationality?
questions.explanation:
Egyptian & Egypt & Egyptians.

	Medieval Europeans believed them to be from Egypt, originally.

questions.text: The Gypsies refer to themselves by which of the following?
They refer to non-Gypsies as what?
Which of the following is not a currently identified Gypsy ethnic group?
questions.explanation:
Keldish.

	Kalderash are also known as Vlax-Romani. Kale are also known as Gitanos.

questions.text: Are the Gypsies represented in any world bodies? Yes or no?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	They are represented in the United Nations with a voting seat.

questions.text: During the Spanish Inquisition, gypsies were punished for speaking their own language. What was the most common way in which they were punished?
questions.explanation:
tongue removed.

	Of course, this would also prevent them from speaking Spanish as well...where's the logic?

questions.text: Who considered the Gypsies to be the 'lowest category' in the racial hierarchy?
questions.explanation:
Hitler.

	About a half million Gypsies died in concentration camps during World War II. Their deaths were not recorded, due to their low status according to Hitler and his ilk.

questions.text: Which word best describes the Gypsy community?
questions.explanation:
Diaspora.

	The Gypsies have been accused of chicanery and evil, but they are actually a very peaceful people. Their dispersion has been compared with the Jewish Diaspora.
